overall_summary: The reasoning demonstrates a methodical approach to time-series analysis with limited historical data (96 hourly points). The model prioritizes simplicity due to data constraints, carefully evaluating seasonality patterns and day-of-week effects before selecting a straightforward averaging method. The process includes thorough data inspection, consideration of multiple forecasting techniques, and attention to output formatting.
common_data_patterns: No missing values in provided data
key_insights: Prioritizing simplicity when historical data is limited (4 days)
Explicit consideration of day-of-week mismatches between historical and forecast periods
Hourly averaging as a fallback when same-day references are unavailable
Data rounding to maintain consistency with input precision
Rejection of complex models (e.g., ARIMA) due to insufficient data points
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with multi-step evaluation of alternatives, but ultimately implements simple heuristics due to data limitations. Includes seasonality analysis, pattern recognition, and method comparison before execution.
